newsitem.title: JAPAN: S.Korea may join international chip body-EIAJ head.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea may join international chip body-EIAJ head.

text.p: South Korea may shortly announce its participation in the World Semiconductor Conference (WSC), which is scheduled to hold its first meeting in Hawaii on April 11, Electronics Industry Association of Japan (EIAJ) chairman Norio Ohga told reporters on Monday.
Members of the international chip body, which groups European countries, the United States and Japan, are required to implement tariff cuts on electronics products earlier than the year 2000.

"European countries have already decided to cut tariffs earlier than 2000. It is possible South Korea can reduce its tariff rate at the same pace as the European countries," a spokesman at the EIAJ said.

The WSC, which analyses global chip market trends and aims to promote industry cooperation, was set up after the expiration of the U.S.-Japan semiconductor agreement which encouraged Japanese firms to buy a certain percentage of foreign-made chips.
